definition: hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]

sentences.english: The brushes have bristles of animal hair, with a very fine point.
sentences.chinese: 毛筆用動物的毛髮製成，筆尖很細。

sentences.english: Not forget that the wall of the room a few obtrusive calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 忘不了房間牆壁上那幾個礙眼的毛筆字。

sentences.english: He is very fond of decorative study objects, and has collected several hundred writing brushes alone.
sentences.chinese: 他非常喜愛文房清玩，僅毛筆就收藏了幾百支。

sentences.english: Chinese painting is known for its brush drawings in black inks and natural colours.
sentences.chinese: 中國畫用毛筆蘸黑墨和天然顏料畫成，並以此著稱。

sentences.english: Oracle should be the first to write with a brush, then use the weapon carved.
sentences.chinese: 甲骨文也應該是先用毛筆寫出，然後再用利器刻出的。

sentences.english: Chinese painting its brush drawings in black inks and natural colours.
sentences.chinese: 中國畫用毛筆蘸黑墨和天然顏料畫成，並以此而著稱。

sentences.english: That's because the members of the Lanting calligraphy club are writing Chinese characters with traditional brushes.
sentences.chinese: 這是因爲蘭亭書法社的成員們正在練毛筆字。

sentences.english: Brushes of the Warring States and modern brushes.
sentences.chinese: 圖爲戰國時的毛筆和現代毛筆。

sentences.english: Brushes of the Warring States and modern brushes.
sentences.chinese: 圖爲戰國時的毛筆和現代毛筆。

sentences.english: Hengshui since ancient times, rich brush, known as "brush the Holy Land" of.
sentences.chinese: 衡水自古盛產毛筆，素有“毛筆聖地”之稱。

sentences.english: Hengshui since ancient times, rich brush, known as "brush the Holy Land" of.
sentences.chinese: 衡水自古盛產毛筆，素有“毛筆聖地”之稱。

sentences.english: Among the various tools of calligraphy, writing brush is peculiar to China.
sentences.chinese: 在各種書法工具中，毛筆是中國特有的。

sentences.english: Basically, one should use five fingers to hold a Chinese writing brush and keep the shaft upright.
sentences.chinese: 拿中國毛筆的方法一般是五指執筆法，筆桿要豎直。

sentences.english: Writing brushes made in Ming and Qing Dynasties are precious nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 明清時的毛筆，已是稀世珍寶了。

sentences.english: Skilled craftsmen use special brushes to draw miniature pictures on the inner surface of the boxes.
sentences.chinese: 熟練的工匠用特別的毛筆在壺內表面作微型畫。

definition: pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
nib/pen point/the tip of a writing brush or pencil
